result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo J Robles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  No contact w/victime unless the victim and agent agree

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricardo J Robles in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called appearances given at 11:40 am.  Deft enters the following pleas.
15CF255 No contest plea to Counts 2 & 4. Count 1&3 - DRI
16CF7 Charge is amended to misdemeanor B/J - No contest plea
16CF44.  Count 2 is amended to misdemanor B/J.  Deft pleas no contest to Counts 1 & amended count 2.  Count 3&4 DRI.
Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders:
15CF255:
36 months Probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
60 days jail w/huber begin today
Undergo Domestic Abuse Intake. Treatment if necessary
No contact w/victim unless victim and agent agrees
DNA sample to be provided
8 days sentence credit

16CF7:
36 months Probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
no contact w/victim unless the victim and agent agree
26 days sentence credit

16CF44:
36 months Probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
no contact w/victim unless victim and agents agree
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises
55 days sentence credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ricardo J Robles in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of information - Waive reading - Plea not guilty - This case transferred to Branch I - Bond continued  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ricardo J Robles in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has Attorney Laufenberg - Defendant states Attorney Laufenberg was appointed previously on a different case - Court advises defendant he has to apply for a Court appointed attorney again for this case - Deputy Orzech called - Sworn - Direct by Dunphy - Defendant identified by witness - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt of information - Waive reading - Court will put off arraignment for defendant to have time to obtain counsel - Bond continued  Arraignment scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo J Robles in court, in custody via video - .  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint - Right to counsel - Court advises defendant of charge - Dunphy to bail - Cash bond set - Prelim set  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
